alert.note: Alert for Cheatham; Robertson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 20 at 12:16PM CDT until July 20 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM CDT FOR NORTHERN MONTGOMERY...NORTHEASTERN CHEATHAM AND ROBERTSON COUNTIES... At 1216 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Guthrie, or 8 miles east of Clarksville, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Clarksville, Springfield, Oak Grove, Fort Campbell, Greenbrier, Coopertown, Cross Plains, Guthrie, Pleasant View, Orlinda, Adams and Cedar Hill. This includes Interstate 24 between mile markers 1 and 31. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
